title: J-K Flip-Flop Function Block
description: This function block implements a J-K flip-flop, which is a type of digital memory circuit. The flip-flop has inputs for setting, resetting, clocking, and the J and K conditions. When reset or set signals are activated, the output Q is determined accordingly. On the clock edge, Q changes based on the values of J and K.
name: FF_JKE

input.name: SET
input.description: Input to set the flip-flop to high.

input.name: J
input.description: Input that determines the next state of Q when activated.

input.name: CLK
input.description: Clock signal that synchronizes state changes.

input.name: K
input.description: Input that determines the next state of Q when activated.

input.name: RST
input.description: Input to reset the flip-flop to low.

output.name: Q
output.description: Current state of the flip-flop output.
